title: Carrot Cake Energy Balls

ingredients.content: 100 - 120 g carrots, cut in pieces (2 cm)

preparations.content: Place carrots in mixing bowl then grate <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place dates, apricots, apple sauce, maple syrup and vanilla extract in mixing bowl then chop <b>6 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add oats, coconut flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger and reserved grated carrot then mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. Scrape down sides and lid of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>.
Place desiccated coconut in a bowl. Take heaped tablespoons of mixture, form into 12 balls then roll in coconut until covered.
Serve or store in fridge in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

hintsAndTricks: Light and fluffy, these energy-laden balls have all the elements of a carrot cake wrapped up in a tasty ball! For additional protein, a scoop of protein powder could be added instead of the coconut flour. A delicious pre or post run snack, which non-runners would enjoy as well!
